abstract: Shares of JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup  and Bank of America tumbled to multiyear lows on Wednesday on expectations that deteriorating credit conditions and a contracting economy will weigh heavily on the three largest U.S. banks.
lead_paragraph: Shares of JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup  and Bank of America tumbled to multiyear lows on Wednesday on expectations that deteriorating credit conditions and a contracting economy will weigh heavily on the three largest U.S. banks.

headline.main: Selloff Leaves Bank Stocks at Multiyear Lows
